author: {'steamid': '76561198293227795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1573731347}
review:
Ich bin hin- und hergerissen, wie ich das Spiel bewerten soll. Letztlich ist es ein klassisches, old-fashioned Wimmelbildspiel mit einer interessanten Zeitreise-Story, die mir gut gefallen hat. Im Vordergrund steht das Wimmel-Element, aber es gibt auch ein paar spa√üige Minispiele und Items, die man Finden und an andrer Stelle einsetzen muss.

Die Grafik ist eben - wie gesagt - old-fashioned, aber das Spiel macht dennoch Spa√ü. Das einzige, was mich gest√∂rt hat, war dieses furchtbare, immer wieder heller werdende Licht im "Museums"-Raum. Und in diesen Raum muss man im Verlauf des Spiels ziemlich oft...

F√ºr Freunde des Genres w√ºrde ich das Spiel empfehlen, aber man sollte sich vorher √ºberlegen, ob man nicht lieber ein grafisch und technisch moderneres HOG spielen m√∂chte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068169042', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1534498910}
review:
My recomendation is YES only for fans of this series and Artifex Mundi generally. As the "about" text states, it is Remastered version of the old game. I believe you can see it on the HOSs that the contrast is good and items are bigger and easier to identify. But I feel the game is outdated despite the fact it is remastered. In the time of the release it had to be superb and it still is. Nice minigames, HO, good story.
Generaly I have to say NO but when compared to other older HOGs it is really on different higher level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994129822', 'num_games_owned': 2200, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1573697382}
review:
Only for fans of the genre.

The plot is not very original to say the least but there are enough puzzles to keep you busy. Sometimes the hidden objects are hard to spot but the game is never unfair.

Graphics are a bit dated and the game is stretched when using fullscreen mode which can look a bit nasty on widescreen monitors. Windowed mode is fine however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227942340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1572972200}
review:
This game was ok 10 years ago, now it is way too outdated to actually be enjoyable. I could try calling it "vintage" but it is just old and it feels old.

PROs:

* Some of the puzzles are fun
* Steam achievements/ card
* Easy 100%

CONs:

* The price for such an oldie is a joke, not worth it
* Repetitive, annoying music
* HO scenes are blurred and messy, have fun pointlessly clicking to find the list of objects
* Easy puzzles
* Short
* No bonus chapter
* Simple, incoherent plot

Unless you want to fell "good old times" don't buy it. There is so many good and great HOPA games out there, this one would be just waste of your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188927953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1567337480}
review:
I just finished this game shows 5 hours game time, that could be due to in early bit was not launching took few tries then it happened. This is a older game seems to be remastered and it is alright as it deals with time travel and you can travel to different timelines. 

I think the story was good and you are trying to get different rings and another person is travelling too and was interesting to have the ball talk to you, and some puzzles were weird like give medicine to sick priest who did not talk to you. The puzzles can be easy to hard and a skip button is there too.

There are two sequels to the game so if interested in those then buy them too as it will help you understand the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1567185822}
review:
Spielwertung: 6/10

- f√ºr Artifex-Mundi-Standards etwas steife Grafik/Texturen/Animationen, aber durchaus ansprechend
- keine sehr originelle Story rund um das Thema "Zeitreisen"
- Die einzelnen Stops in den Jahrhunderten haben dagegen durchaus seinen Reiz
- Das Overlay f√§llt etwas ab zu anderen AM-Spielen. Das Minispiele selten erkl√§rt werden und man erst auf die Hilfe klicken muss, ist etwas unsch√∂n. Auch die nur 2 vorhandenen Schwierigkeitsgrade sind wenig, denn auf Leicht will man es ja nicht spielen. Da sind die AM-Spiele mit 3, in denen man immer gem√ºtlich Mitte nehmen kann, schon besser. Au√üerdem gab es keine fortgeschrittenen Aufdeckspiele oder Kombinationsfunde im Wimmelbild. 
- Gerade die Wimmelbildspiele sind in diesem Game besonders nervig und wirklich nichts f√ºr Epileptiker. Die st√§ndige Lichtstreuung zwischen Hell und Dunkel ist sehr, sehr schlimm. 
- Der Schwierigkeitsgrad auf schwer ist etwas happig, aber ich bin mit 1x Hilfe in den Minispielen und 2x in den Wimmelbildern ausgekommen. 
- Spielzeit betrug ca. 3.5 Stunden

Fazit: Nicht mein bestes AM-Erlebnis, aber trotzdem ein kurzer aber ansprechender Happen f√ºr zwischendurch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007688772', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 649, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1562239748}
review:
Almost entertainingly bad. Almost.
The story is ridiculously stupid. Dialogue animations are laughably bad; everyone's head just widens, shrinks and deforms as they speak. The gameplay is all about hidden-objects but the scenes have ugly low-res graphics where some items are virtually invisible. And everything is just bare minimum - the HO scenes are just static images and a list of items. The adventuring is simple with just a few items to use and puzzles are the same as always. Also the games is really short. The only good thing about Time Mysteries is the music.
Skip this one. There are literally hundreds of better HO games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201855922', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1518038283}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009393197', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1562213983}
review:
Not a good HOG at all. It's boring and quite tiresome to play. There are heaps of better HOGs out there, try one of them. This is not Artifex Mundi's finest hour. A 35/100 effort.

[b]The good[/b]

Music is OK
A couple of challenging puzzles

[b]The bad[/b]

Terrible (hilarious) character facial animations
HOG scenes are blurry
Some objects don't match their descriptions - i.e a baseball != a tennis ball
Boring, repetitive gameplay
Minimal replay value

author: {'steamid': '76561198027686399', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1562796262}
review: This is definitely an older one but I've enjoyed it. Sometimes the older ones are harder, because the art, while still beautiful, is not as crisp, making it more difficult to find stuff. That's either a pro or a con depending on your preference. I bought this on sale and played it from a hospital bed. I've had plenty of fun, worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388087489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1584916610}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066154260', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1561909716}
review:
Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered is an older title from the Artifex Mundi catalogue. Some of these old games are still fun to play, but this one isn‚Äôt. It isn‚Äôt all bad but suffers from badly animated cut-scenes, blurry graphics and rather poor voice-acting. You get to travel to many different centuries in a dull story. There is no bonus part and the game is over after 2,9 hours.

There are plenty of HOP‚Äôs and mini games, but due to the overall blurriness they are quite tiring for the eyes. There is no real variation of the HOP‚Äôs, all of them are text. There are no collectibles and no map as you only explore about two scenes at a time. I don‚Äôt want to be too hard on this game as at the time it was originally published it must have been quite neat.

You should only buy this game if you are a completionist and want to own all of Artifex Mundi‚Äôs games or at least the complete Time Mysteries series. If you can get it on a heavy discount or don‚Äôt care about blurry graphics at all you might consider buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101776626', 'num_games_owned': 5243, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1559492343}
review:
I'm pretty amazed by the fact they wrote "remastered" in the title. To be honest, you already know it's going to be a wild ride when you're 10mn in and had the pleasure to hear her complaining about a man crashing and leaving on the celestial road while she didn't even know about said road literally 3 seconds before.
After finishing the game, I can add that I really dislike the MC who is constantly complaining. Yes, me too I would like it to have been shorter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1558921500}
review:
Very short puzzle game, featuring mostly Hidden Object Puzzles with some smaller puzzles in between.

Pros:
- Interesting story line.
- The most challenging Hidden Object Puzzles I've come across in some time.
- Some very nice artwork.

Cons:
- Some words are wrong or misleading.
- Sometimes multiple objects appear in the same hidden object scene, but only one is the correct one.
- The animation is poorly done, as when a character speaks their head wobble about like they're in a funhouse mirror.

Other:
- The game is extremely short. I'd like to be able to play it longer, but at the same time having such a quick little game is very nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 1809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1559003798}
review:
Worth buying at a strong discount; the premise is interesting, and the basic mechanics and music are good.

But:  the HO scenes are overly hard at times because the graphics are so challenging (and the sort of pulsing, ultra-bright ambient light in some puzzles is more headache-inducing than a "fun challenge").

Also, I have to mention the Squidgy Squoodgy head and faces thing.  They had some difficulties with their animation of people talking (the voice acting's pretty good though).  It's hard to take either threats or warnings seriously when you keep waiting for the speaker to grab hold of their head and run away screaming "I'm MELLLLTING!"

Bottom line:  it's remastered, and it shows; could have used a little more work in order to spare players some eye-strain.  I'm happy to have it in my collection, because I like complete sets.  Also, it did have its up sides.  I'd say that a "Mostly Positive" or "Mixed" review is reasonable, but if you enjoy Artifex Mundi, you should get it.

review: I am a simple man. I see Artifex Mundi, I buy'em. But this one, it is not like the ones I consider as Artifex Mundi quality. It has simpler storyline, many of the HO scenes are eye-tiring and there are no explanations for mini-games. Well, it is still enjoyable. If you like HO games, you may wanna have this one. Try to have it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179604937', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1549258635}
review:
I wish there was a middle option because I don't want to rate it down, but I don't really want to give it a thumbs up either. I found this game way too easy. The graphics were a bit meh in some of the hidden object scenes. I actually had to do some random clicking to find a few things, not because they were well hidden, but because I couldn't see them at all. They were pixelated and faded into the background. I ran through the game twice in that 4.9 hours out of curiousity and I can tell you, even the second time around, knowing where those objects were, I had to random click in the general area. 

Definitely not one of the best Artifex Mundi games. Too simplistic and repetitive. I would expect higher graphics quality for the hidden object scenes in a remastered version. That was just lazy.

Great game for children since it's not scary in any way. Many of Artifex Mundi's games are not suitable for kids. Not so great for adults though.  5/10

review:
Es macht Spa√ü und damals hatte ich es mir f√ºr ein paar Euro gekauft. 

Pros:
+ Thema Zeitreisen, verschiedene Epochen
+ Game in verschiedenen Sprachen
+ Steam Errungenschaften
+ Steam Sammelkarten
+ Steam Cloud

Kontra:
- gef√ºhlsm√§√üig kurzes Game
- nicht allzu viele verschiedene variable Wimmelbilder

Die Story ist insgesamt nett und ok. Da es ein kurzes Game ist kann man nat√ºrlich keine komplexe Story erwarten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050149981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1547238554}
review: Awful character animation and acting. Almost everything having to do with the characters is awfully done. Sometimes so much it's laughable. But mostly cringy. Game, including puzzles generally too repetative, and too easy. Some unfortunate/clumsy jumps in story/movement that takes you out of the flow of the story. Feels glitchy. The main story idea is interesting, but they have made the plot boring. Some really nice sceneries and puzzles though, but overall, not really worth it, unless you're very keen on shallowly moving through historical periods and their aesthetics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079562887', 'num_games_owned': 1261, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1544310549}
review:
Okay HOG but does have some hiccups, so I recommended picking it up during a sale. 
Some of the hidden objects are so faded into the background that their shape can't be seen clearly. 
Some items appear more than once in a scene. An example: Find a crown but there are two crowns in the scene. Only one of them completes the objective. 
I am no fan of the lighting in the HOG scenes - The light repeatedly brightens and fades, which was giving me a headache.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073375206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1524214105}
review: A below average HOG Game. I can't recommend this game unless you are a big HOG fan. The art and animations look dated. My child did get some enjoyment out of this but unless you are buying it for a child I would recommend you pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118005728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 566, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1478834576}
review: Time Mysteries: Inheritance is a very good HOG. It has an interesting story, good graphics, nice music and sounds. The hidden object scenes are very well-done and the minigames are great. I really enjoyed this HOG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312404158', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1535322164}
review: I quite enjoy hidden object games--they're the mind candy of games, for me.  Something to do when I don't feel like either a big investment in time or a large expenditure of mental energy.  Even by the rather lax standards of hidden object games, however, this one is very sub-par.  Many of the hidden object scenes are made extra annoying by fluctuating light levels.  Many are also subject to the poor translation that dogs these games--the clues don't necessarily match what *I* would expect the objects to be.  Some are just pixel hunts.  The animations are...awful.  Many of the puzzles lack instructions, though I suppose it's possible that might be specific to the Linux version.  If you can get this for a dollar or less, it'll waste two hours of your gaming life.  If it costs more than that, find another game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355021047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1578442416}
review: Ich mag die Spiele von Artifex Mundi, aber dieses hat mehr Frust als Lust gebracht. Die Geschichte ist uninteressant bis eigentlich nicht wirklich vorhanden. Die Wimmelbilder machen so gar keinen Spa√ü, weil einige Dinge √ºberhaupt nicht erkennbar sind und die Maps sich wiederholen. Normalerweise spiele ich alle Erfolge frei, doch dieses Mal werde ich darauf verzichten. Wenn man auf der Suche nach sch√∂nen Wimmelbildspielen ist, sollte man sich nach anderen Titeln von Artifex Mundi umsehen, da sind n√§mlich so einige wirklich sch√∂ner Spiele bei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041824954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1531707972}
review:
This game is in no way truly good. The plot is non-sensical, the logical leaps are vast, and the face "animations" (really more of a warping of  a 2D image) are terrifying. The hidden object puzzles are tough and often have objects blend into the background. The additional puzzles are simplistic. 

But this game is also amazing. The plot lines are tangled and inconsistent, and it's bad in the best way. If you're looking for a satisfying puzzle game that provides about three hours of constant amusement, this is the game for you.

review:

En faisant abstraction de la faiblesse des justifications donn√©es √† leurs enchainements, apr√®s tout ce n'est pas pour leur histoire qu'on se lance dans les jeux d'objets cach√©s, j'ai bien aim√© les puzzles et j'aurai surement aim√© les SOC sans ces jeux de lumi√®re variable et flou qui mettront en vrac ou de mauvais poil tous les photosensibles dans mon genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1527115037}
review: This title is the first one in the Time Mysteries trilogy, which are point-and-click adventure games published by Artifex Mundi. From what I found, this was also their first game. And boy, it shows. This game is ugly to look at. The Steam version is supposed to be Remastered, but if that is the case, I don‚Äôt want to check the original version. The music is ok, the story meh, there‚Äôs variety in the scenery, and the puzzles not too hard. The problem is those hidden object minigames. You have to search them in those terrible graphics. There‚Äôs an optional minigame, buy playing it prevents you from getting an achievement. In this case, I‚Äôm thankful that this game is short. The gameplay itself isn‚Äôt bad, but the graphics are important in this genre. And they killed this game for me. Only get it if you want the full trilogy. Otherwise don‚Äôt bother and pick any other game from this developer. This is clearly their black sheep, and not even a Remaster could save it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037919726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1519677744}
review:
This game has a very poor, boring, unfinished story. Few things are worth attention. Rest is not good.

+ Nice and not so easy games to find differences
+ Few intresting puzzles
+ Relaxing nice music
+ Decent number od puzzles, hidden objects scenes and games to find differences

- Most of the puzzles are banal
- Hidden object scenes are tragic. Some object are literally melted in other objects or the scene and almost imposible to find
- This is one of the worst stories that i have seen in computer games and it is unfinished
- Hidden objects scenes with searching of objects from different ages are terrible, some flashing light with can give you a hedache.
- Quite short

Overall: 3/10

Only worth buing with a big discount, some 66%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017661158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1519013984}
review:
Fairly simple, but satisfying.  Good for younger children but still mindless fun for adults.  There are some translation issues to be aware of - things like asking you to find a "fiddle" when it's pretty clearly a lute.  It could be frustrating if trying to be a perfectionist, but it's also forgiving of mistakes.

Unfortunately it also had two "lights out" style puzzles which I loathe with every fibre of my being, so I didn't get the "no skips" achievement.  Alas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004233477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1518412984}
review:
I have played a bunch of hidden object puzzle adventure games, mostly by Artifex Mundi, and this is hands-down the worst one I've played in the genre.

The game is highly repetitive. There's a series of hidden object puzzles for a given era that you must solve to solve a normal puzzle/minigame. Then, you go back to a time travel hub, have to do a "spot the differences" game, do a hidden object puzzle to earn the items to go to the next era. Rinse, repeat.

Various things make this game's hidden object puzzles especially frustrating: a low resolution, muddy graphics, items that are 90% obscured by other objects (one object was partially off-screen and especially difficult to see). Many items are frankly too small to see, and blend into other objects too much.

The spot the difference games are particularly annoying because of the above issues and because many of the differences are frankly too hard to spot.

I know there's a thin line between challenging and unfair, but this game's hidden object puzzles and difference spotting minigames are on the unfair side.

Look at Artifex Mundi's "Nightmares From The Deep" series if you are interested in their work. This is definitely a game to skip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158004807', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1512963579}
review:
This game has lots and lots of HOGs which are on the more difficult side, plus interesting puzzles. However, I encountered one HOG outside the witch's house with a missing item (an EYE), so I was forced to play the minigame to continue. Sometimes the HOG clue words did not IMO match the actual item. I liked the fact that there were FInd the DIfferences in the Images puzzles.

The voice acting is fabulously cheesy. As people talk, their heads deform in a most disturbing way. There are occasional mixed up characters / voices and lines. The story is WTF? and the ending is WTFFF? I ended up turning the music off because it was so repetitive it drove me crazy.

Overall, an OK puzzle game. Not that great of a story, though I did like visiting all the different times. The second game in the series is much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972999224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 284, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1436921575}
review: Not sure why this game isn't getting more love. I thought it was a decent enough HOG. Maybe get it on sale if your worried about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149384609', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1607401504}
review:
This was ok but honestly I did get a little bored and I'm glad I had it set to casaul so I could click away at some of the hidden object scenes to get them done faster.

The graphics are not consistant and it makes the HOS sometimes hard to actually see things to find them.  Sometimes your looking at painting to find objects, sometimes it's a room that repeats or it's another scene but I found the graphics just not as pleasant to look at as some other AM games have.

The characters are done in a very weird way.  They are static characters but seems to have some kind of overlay of movement that makes their heads and mouths move wierdly and bodies wave around to fien movement.   Half the time it looks like they have had terrible dental work done and their jaws are unhinged when they talk. 

There is barely anything to find or figure out to do in each scene, mini game/puzzles are minimal and sometimes it's a repeat of the same type of puzzle.    One of the character's voices is terrible as this VA simply sounds like he was bored even trying to have a character's personality and he sounds robotic as if he's simply reading the words on the script page.

The other two character voices are ok.  At least they have some kind of expression in their voices. 

I like AM's Hidden Object games and disappointed they aren't making any new ones anymore however this one is one of my least favorites.   It may be this game was one of their first and there for a bit unpolished but I have played older HOGs with even not that polished graphics that I have enjoyed more and this one just seems a bit to thrown together without a lot of thought into it.

This game came out in 2010 so for this genre of game it's considered a bit dated so I'm willing to say it's for that reason it's this way.

If this is included in a bundle I'd say fine get it.  If it's super sale time and you want all three in the series I'd say get it.  
I have the other 2 in the series and plan to play them and given that they were probably out different years I may find they have progressed.  We shall see.

oh and I am not sure why this is 'Remastered' version?  what makes this a premium collection and remastered?  
there were no extras and while there seems to have been steam achievements I didn't find any in game achievement section.   Anyway I am not sure why it's called Premium collection Remastered ( as it says this in the game).

author: {'steamid': '76561198145557537', 'num_games_owned': 1033, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1510343750}
review:
Decent game. The "animation" is comically bad, and Michale's voice actor is cringeworthy, but the fun puzzles and minigames and decent story make up for many sins. Good enough for a first installment.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055531472', 'num_games_owned': 1179, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1509995891}
review: I recommend this not because it is good (which it isn't), but instead because of the genre of this game. This one took me about 3 hours to play, that counts me doing all of the puzzles without skipping and I didn‚Äôt use any hints as well to 100% the achievements. I have played all 3 installments, this is by far the worst of the 3. However I have played through worse games of the same type on steam. The "Time Mysteries" trilogy as a whole is about mid tier as far as you'll find for this genre on Steam. It's not the best, but it's certainly not the worst. I would say you could skip this game because of the sheer quality jump from game one to game two, but the thing is the three games form a whole story. Granted it's kind of a weird time traveling mess of a story it's still there and interesting enough to go through. That being said though I definitely suggest getting all three of them when they're on a really good sale if you do choose to play them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1509959366}
review:
This game is one of Artifex Mundi's first, and you can see... the rough edges. The minigames are still fun, and the HO scenes decent, but the plot... is a bit less than their newer games. Still, it is a nice game to play. I would suggest getting it on discount, but beside that, not any real down points.

Also, I tend to think the time travel involved might involve the same location, just different times...

author: {'steamid': '76561198093311284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1509179660}
review:
Time Mysteries ist ein klassisches Wimmelbildspiel aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi, wie man sie reihenweise kennt. Time Mysteries: Inheritance geh√∂rt meiner Meinung allerdings zu den eher schw√§cheren Spielen, das sich vor allem durch seine √úbersetzungsschw√§chen und teilweise langweiligen Szenenbilder auszeichnet. Trotz der Kritik, die im Folgenden noch etwas genauer dargelegt wird, macht das R√§tseln und Suchen von Objekten trotzdem wieder Spa√ü. Wer erfahren genug ist, auch Objekte zu finden, die falsch √ºbersetzt sind, wird auch an diesem Spiel seinen Spa√ü finden. Wen so etwas nervt und in Rage bringt, sollte seinen Blick vielleicht lieber auf ein anderes Wimmelbildspiel aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi werfen.

Die Story, die bei vielen Wimmelbildspielen stark in den Hintergrund tritt, zeigt gute Ideen und Ans√§tze, verliert sich aber schnell in einem Aneinanderreihen von sinnlos verkn√ºpften Zeitreisen. Das Verfolgen eines anderen Zeitreisenden wird viel zu selten in den Blick genommen. So sieht man diesen zwar zwischendurch, findet auch mal den ein oder anderen Gegenstand des "Widersachers", aber im Gro√üen und Ganzen ist er immer "gerade eben vorbei gekommen und hat das gleiche gesucht wie ich". Interaktion mit diesem findet bis zum letzten Kapitel √ºberhaupt nicht statt. 

Die verschiedenen Szenen, welche die einzelnen Zeitepochen widerspiegeln sollen, sind teilweise lustlos und v√∂llig stereotypisch aufgebaut. Ein Jahrhundert ist in 3-4 Minuten erledigt, im n√§chsten h√§ngt man ewig herum, weil das Zu-Suchende v√∂llig unersichtlich in der Szenerie eingebaut wurde. So wird beispielsweise das Mittelalter sofort zum Ritterturnier und die Fr√ºhe Neuzeit in ein Kloster versetzt. Zwischen den einzelnen Epochen befindet man sich immer wieder in der Gegenwart, in der man jedes(!) Mal, das gleiche Wimmelbild vorgesetzt bekommt, aus dem man auch immer wieder die gleichen Gegenst√§nde suchen muss. Allerdings wird die Szenerie immer wieder neu "gef√ºllt" und somit sind die Gegenst√§nde an anderen Orten platziert. Dennoch ist das gleiche Bild sp√§testens beim dritten oder vierten Mal nicht mehr sch√∂n. Zumal die Lichteffekte, die eingebaut wurden, ein genaues Hinsehen so dema√üen st√∂ren, dass ich teilweise Pausen machen musste, weil meine Augen einfach nicht mehr in die teilweise √ºberbelichteten Stellen schauen konnten.

Ein letzter Kritikpunkt w√§re die Auswahl der Objekte, die zu finden sind. √úbersetzungefehler, die aus einer Taschenuhr eine Armbanduhr oder aus einem einfachen F√§cher einen Ventilator machen, f√ºhren immer wieder zu Schwierigkeiten. Leichter wird das Ganze allerdings dadurch, dass in nahezu jeder Szene eine Lupe, ein Paar Handschuhe oder auch ein Paar Schuhe gesucht werden muss. Ohne zu lesen, sind drei Elemente also sofort suchbar. 

Fazit: Wie bereits erw√§hnt, eines der schw√§cheren Spiele, aber dennoch f√ºr Wimmelbild-Fans ein lohnender Blick. F√ºr Neulinge oder Leute, die hin und wieder Spa√ü am wimmeln haben m√∂chten, w√ºrde ich abraten.

review: The hidden object scenes are poorly done, with many of the objects not well defined enough to tell what they are. The animations of the people talking are really creepy. The puzzles are repetitive. And finally the story is not engaging at all. I wouldn't recommend this unless you've got nothing else to play and it's on sale for free or practically free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156058850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1505799214}
review:
Time Mysteries: Inheritance √® una classica avventura grafica Hidden Objects sviluppata da Artifex Mundi.

La storia √® carina e interessante, anche se a tratti sembra quasi che corra troppo veloce e alcuni dettagli vengono tralasciati. Per il resto, l'avventura di Vivien Ambrose dovrebbe risultare abbastanza godibile.

Le schermate Hidden Objects non hanno nulla di particolare. Semplicemente c'√® una lista di oggetti da scovare, niente di pi√π. I vari enigmi invece sono stati carini, ma (per quanto mi riguarda) troppo semplici, sar√† perch√® ormai sono abituato a questo genere di giochi.

Tecnicamente invece il gioco lascia un po' a desiderare. Innanzitutto √® (o meglio, dovrebbe essere) una remastered edition, invece si ha lo stesso la sensazione di un gioco vecchiotto. La risoluzione √® pessima, a volte √® persino difficile trovare certi oggetti perch√® troppo sgranati o sfocati. Le aree di gioco sono completamente piatte, con pochissime animazioni.
Lo stile del disegno invece non √® male, anzi.

Per quanto riguarda il sonoro non siamo certamente al top, ma √® accettabile. Il doppiaggio √® solo inglese. Le musiche adatte all'atmosfera. Buoni anche gli effetti sonori.

Ho riscontrato qualche errore di traduzione o imprecisioni negli oggetti (es: Brush = spazzola/pennello).

In definitiva: Per circa 3-4 ore di gioco, la bassa qualit√† (ricordo che si tratta di una remastered) e qualche errorino qua e l√†, forse non vale la pena spendere il prezzo pieno. In bundle o in sconto √® comunque da acquistare se si ama il genere. Ricordo inoltre che √® il primo capitolo di una trilogia.

Decepci√≥n. Es lo que puedo decir de este juego de B√∫squeda de Objetos.
Guion, dise√±o de efectos y secuencias, son vast√≠simas y penosas. 
Otro aspecto que no me ha gustado, es que no explique los puzles, y si le das al bot√≥n de ‚ÄúPista‚Äù para saber c√≥mo va el minijuego, te penalizan con no obtener uno de los logros Steam.
Hay alguna que otra errata en la traducci√≥n al castellano.
Sinceramente, si te gustan los juegos de B√∫squeda de Objetos, no te aconsejo comprarlo. Porque es malo. En calidad, ‚ÄúTime Mysteries: Inheritance ‚Äì Remastered‚Äù no supera a la saga Grim Legends.
Aun habi√©ndote aconsejado de no adquirirlo, decides comprarlo, te recomiendo solo hacerte con el juego, si lo encuentras por 1‚Ç¨, formando parte de alg√∫n bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230627652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1504574247}
review:
Although this is certainly not in the league of other Artifex Mundi games (play Enigmatis or Grim Legends series and then nothing compares though), I must confess I ended up enjoying this simply because of it's naffness. Plus you can snigger endlessly throughout if you love an innuendo, because this game basically revolves around rings and balls.

Biggest annoyances were the lack of instructions in the games as to what I was meant to be doing, and some of the resolution made the HOG puzzles extra hard. However, some of the puzzles were genuinely challenging on the plus side.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995982646', 'num_games_owned': 4614, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1503830543}
review:
In comparison with other, more conventional, newer,  HOG's from Artifex Mundi, this one revolves around a central point: the Time Machine. From here, you embark on a journey through different centuries. In every era a ring has to be retrieved, which (in combination with items) unlocks a door to the next era.

Hidden object scenes are plentiful and come in a rather consecutive order. Maybe better would've been if they alternate a bit more between HO-scenes and puzzles. The fewer puzzles that you'll encounter are fun and not too hard. The mini-game that one can choose instead of the HO-scene, a match 4 game, is tedious and frustrating though. I'd recommend sticking with the HO-scenes instead.

Between each era there's also a game where you have to find 7 differences between 2 appearingly similar pictures.

The music is typical for every era and adds to the feel and atmosphere of your experience. Narratives, the protagonist & other characters with a British accent, give a Doctor Who feel to the game. Character animations are rather comical than realistic, though.

To conclude: Bearing in mind that this game is a remastered version of one of the first games from Artifex Mundi, the game delivers what it should and i enjoyed both my 2 playthroughs to achieve a perfect game. (It can be perfected in one playthrough, but i accidently clicked the hint button in an HO-scene, so i had to go through all again.) It's the first in a trilogy and i'm looking forward to play the next ones. 
Recommended for HO lovers and/or Artifex Mundi games players.

Links to my other Time Mysteries reviews:

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197995982646/recommended/313650]Time Mysteries 2: The Ancient Spectres[/url]

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197995982646/recommended/319320/]Time Mysteries 3: The Final Enigma[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993118789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1502026547}
review:
Overall horrible game with nonsensical story, bad voice acting, abysmal animations and repetitious hidden object puzzles. Time Mysteries: Inheritance ‚Äì Remastered‚Äô fault is not that it appears to be made on a shoestring budget; instead the true horror of this game lies in the zero percent of ambition it expresses. 

The only good thing is the static artwork that is stunning though, again, completely lacks an original intent in its expression. Animations are especially appalling: when every character starts talking, their heads start morphing, inflating and deflating, and mutating in such a way you‚Äôd think a flesh eating alien would burst out of their skulls! The excuse of the time-travelling story is such an amateurish mess that you‚Äôll stop caring by the time you reach the second cutscene. Music is extremely bland and forgettable, while the sound effects, especially dialogues, are garbled on such a heavy compression, that you‚Äôll hear nasty scratching every time any character speaks.

If this is the ‚ÄúRemastered‚Äù edition, I shudder to think how a standard version looked like. But at least one design priority managed to shine out untouched and compromised: When you start the game and enter the main menu, you will see two giant blue buttons with ‚Äúdon‚Äôt forget to buy more of our stuff!‚Äù It‚Äôs time Marty McFly does the right thing, travels back in time, and throw this ‚Äúgame‚Äù into manure where it belongs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167194795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1500739493}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1501945844}
review:
Dans ce premier √©pisode de la s√©rie Time Mysteries, Vivien Ambrose est amen√©e √† voyager dans le temps afin de retrouver son p√®re. 

Il s'agit pour elle de r√©colter des objets qui permettent de l'envoyer dans une p√©riode d√©termin√©e de l'histoire afin de r√©cup√©rer des bagues magiques.
Elle va r√©aliser la particularit√© de sa famille et sera accompagn√©e dans ses aventures par un orbe de cristal qui parle.

Le jeu dure pas plus de 4h et chaque niveau est assez vite car il n'y a qu'une seule √©nigme √† r√©soudre √† chaque fois pour pouvoir obtenir chaque bague. 
C'est malheureusement assez r√©p√©titif, ne serait-ce que pour passer d'un niveau √† l'autre o√π on retourne au m√™me endroit pour reproduire le m√™me rituel : mettre la bague dans une machine, valider avec un jeu des 7 diff√©rences, faire une SOC, mettre les objets dans la machine.
Enfin, le jeu pr√©sente une interfce tr√®s dat√©e avec des graphismes pratiquement sans aucune animation et pas tr√®s nets. Les recherches en sont rendues d√©sagr√©ables car il n'est pas toujours √©vident de reconna√Ætre clairement tous les objets, m√™me s'il y a un sonar qui permet de conna√Ætre la silhouette des objets √† trouver. Enfin, si tous les textes/sous-titres sont en fran√ßais (malgr√© quelques petites fautes de traduction) et les voix en anglais, on peut regretter que les PNJ secondaires ne soient pas doubl√©s.


Bref, pas un jeu extraordinaire mais il fait n√©anmoins l'affaire pour un divertissement de quelques heures.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997615828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1501714122}
review:
- Durata media: 4 ore circa
La durata √® nella media dei giochi di questo tipo

- Storia: 5/10
Vivien Ambrose una dottoressa in fisica raggiunge il padre a casa sua per festeggiare un importante risulatato scientifico da lei conseguito ma al suo arrivo scopre che il padre √® stato rapito. Una sfera di scristallo parlante e la ricerca di 7 anelli faranno ritrovare il padre scomparso tra viaggi nel tempo e magia? Lo scoprirete risolvendo il mistero che avvolge la famiglia Ambrose da secoli, cosa che apparentemente solo la figlia Vivien sembra ancora non conoscere. La storia non √® niente di speciale ma chiaramente fa da sfondo agli enigmi e agli Hidden Objects riuscendo a dare quel poco interesse necessario per proseguire.

- Gameplay: 4/10
Il gameplay √® quello classico degli Hidden Objects. Classici e veramente banali pure gli enigmi. Non raggiunge la sufficienza troppe volte si chiude la palpebra. Noia...

- Grafica e Animazioni: 4/10
La grafica degli scenari disegnati a mano non √® particolarmente bella e molto lontano dalla sufficienza. Deve essere una versione remastered e invece purtoppo non lo √®, la risoluzione troppo bassa spesso porta a non scovare gli oggetti da trovare per via della scarsa qualit√† dei disegni. Insufficienza anche alle animazioni, soprattutto i personaggi (bruttissimi) e pure l'ambiente circostante (completamente statico). Fluido il motore grafico mai avuto artefatti, bugs o rallentamenti.

- Sound: 5/10
Le musiche sono orecchiabili e adatte all'atmosfera. Anonime e senza carattere le voci dei personaggi tra cui, confermo con le altre recensioni, pessima quella di Vivien . Gli effetti sonori sono buoni.

- Prezzo: 5/10
Ad oggi 03/08/2017 il gioco a prezzo pieno costa 7,99 euro, io lo comprerei al 75% di sconto. Questo per me √® il suo valore effettivo. Io l'ho trovato in un bundle assieme ad altri giochi e quindi pagato decisamente meno.

- Voto Finale: 4 1/2
Gioco vecchio e noiso trai i peggiori Hidden Objects che ho giocato e come primo di una trilogia vi consiglio di passare direttamente al secondo che √® decisamente migliore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076606506', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1501429223}
review:
Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered
--------------------------------------------

This is a very traditional hidden object game. You will stumble across various scenes with smaller riddles to solve and quite some hidden object scenes to complete. The voice acting is not the best and other games of the series have had better voice acting. I advise you to turn them off. The music is ok though. 

All in all I can clearly recommend this game if it's for sale. I would not spend over $5 for the game as there are better hidden object games out there and this one is quite short( I only came up to 6 hours playtime by having it on idle). Still it is not a complete failure and entertaining at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1688436804}
review:
Another great game from Artifex Mundi :)very nice and detailed visuals, quite decent puzzles and fun gameplay. Story is also not bad

I don't have to high expectations when it comes to HOG games I like playing this type of games when my computer is rendering something or I waiting for client feedback and hog games and simple indie games are perfect for that, almost no resources are needed to play it and meantime I can do some heavy rendering and keep eye on progress on second screen while playing game :)
So almost any HOG game is perfect for me, it have to very bad to disappoint me and this one is very good :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198246974276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1506694282}
review: I have played a number of HoGs but this one is, by far, the worst. Played about 5 minutes of it and had to drop it. I can't stand the voice acting of this game at all. It sounded very annoying. I know I shouldn't judge the game solely from its voice acting quality but I strongly believe that that will have a great impact on players. The introduction of a game also plays a huge part. The voice acting ruined the introduction for me. I just can't make myself play this game again. Maybe one day when I ran out of HoGs to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995292755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1498593752}
review:
So, let's be clear here, this is an old game. And it looks far older than 2010 (the release date listed on Artifex's Internetpage, not the one listed on steam).
That being said, it's short, i definitely was entertained and if you just want to chill a bit it's worth your money (maybe wait for a sale though, those 2.5 hours are the time i spent playing.)

I didn't quite see the glaring problems some people seem to have with the lighting changes in some spots but i will admit that the pictures, at times, are a bit bright and not quite on par with what the developer pushes out now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039649734', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1496681776}
review:
No es ni de lejos el mejor juego de Artifex, supongo que sera por que es uno de los primero.

El doblaje es bastante flojo, la historia no es la gran cosa y los personajes cuando hablan y mueven los labios es una vision de los mas creepy.

Sin duda lo mejor de este juego es que puedes sacar facilmente el 100% de los logros jugando solo una vez y que el hecho de ir viajando de epoca en epoca le da cierto saborcillo a la experiencia.

4/10

Jedynym minusem jest to, ≈ºe w grze wystƒÖpuje ciut za du≈ºo lokacji z ukrytymi obiektami, co powoduje zbƒôdne przerywanie fabu≈Çy. author: {'steamid': '76561198173457771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1495682439}
review:
I agree with other reviewers, play 2 and 3 of the series.  Seriously consider skipping this one.  The hidden object screens are too cluttered, dificult and some have issues with lighting changes.  This becomes a problem when you are focusing hard to find objects and the screen's lighting keeps changing.  If you a have problem with this, don't to play this one.  It might bother you.  

If you can get past the issue above, the game is not all bad.  It has ok graphics and storyline.  It also offers a variety of challenging hidden object screens, moderate mini games, and spot the difference puzzles.

Would recommend only if the following applies:  1. You have nothing else to play.  2.  If it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067071348', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1494552468}
review: O primeiro jogo da Artifex Mundi que √© decepcionante.A hist√≥ria de Vivian em busca de seu pai numa viagem que envolve o espa√ßo temporal √© um ted√≠o, as viagens pelo tempo s√£o curtas e os NPC muito desinteresantes. S√£o poucos puzzles e muitos, mas muitos Hidden Objects. author: {'steamid': '76561198025870992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1493802740}
review:
Estamos ante una aventura del estilo hidden objects (objetos ocultos). A pesar de que me pareci√≥ interesante su propuesta de recorrer diferentes √©pocas, debo decir que es de los juegos del g√©nero con una historia peor hilada, est√° todo muy inconexo y nos muestra un juego fragmentado con localizaciones de escasos minutos de duraci√≥n a las que no volver√°s, en lugar de un gran lugar que recorrer durante toda la historia.

En cuanto a las "cinem√°ticas" decir que son de las peores de entre los HOG, quedan bastante mal los gestos faciales ya que se llevan a cabo a base de deformaciones de la imagen.

Por tanto, lo debo poner entre los peores juegos del g√©nero de los que he probado, sobre todo por el gui√≥n, el desarrollo de las localizaciones y el dise√±o de puzzles (las escenas de objetos ocultos s√≠ est√°n correctas y no encontr√© problemas de traducci√≥n que te dificulten la b√∫squeda).

Como punto a favor decir que es de los pocos juegos de Artifex Mundi que no te obligan a jugarlo dos veces para conseguir todos los logros. En la primera partida y de forma f√°cil se hace el 100%.

Juego recomendado solo a precio reducido (menos de 1‚Ç¨) o como parte de un pack barato.

5/10.

review:
[h1]Worum geht es?[/h1]
In diesem Wimmelbildspiel mit dem deutschen Titel [b]R√§tsel der Zeit: Das Erbe - Remastered[/b] handelt es sich um eines der ersten Werke von Entwickler [url=https://www.artifexmundi.com]Artifex Mundi[/url]. In diesem Spiel verk√∂rpert man die Physikerin Vivien Ambrose. Deren Vater ist spurlos verschwunden und dem Mysterium muss man auf die Schliche kommen.

[h1]Mehr Information:[/h1]
Wie typisch f√ºr dieses Genre l√∂st man R√§tsel und muss Gegenst√§nde auf Wimmelbildern suchen. Innerhalb des Geschichtverlaufs kann man durch eine Aparatur durch die Zeit reisen und wandelt damit durch verschiedene zeitliche Epochen.


[b]Pro[/b]

[list]
[*]sch√∂n gezeichnete Bilder Landschaften aus verschiedenen Epochen des Jahrtausends
[*]Texte auf Deutsch √ºbersetzt
[*]nach dem Durchspielen eine lange Bonusmission welche nochmal fordert
[*]gute Spielhilfen f√ºr Anf√§nger vorhanden
[/list]

[b]Contra[/b]
[list]
[*]in den Wimmelbildszenen wurden Objekte teilweise schlampig bzw. falsch √ºbersetzt was zu Sinnfehlern f√ºhrt
[/list]

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Teil Nummer 1 der [url=http://store.steampowered.com/bundle/2582/]Time Mysteries Reihe[/url] ist zu Empfehlen. Die durch das Zeitreisen abwechselnden √ñrtlichkeiten machen Spa√ü und bringen Abwechslung in die typischen Wimmelbildhintergr√ºnde, welche oft einfach nur bunt und √ºberladen sind.

Das Spiel ist vor allem f√ºr Anf√§nger sehr gut geeignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032089697', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1487222290}
review:
Time Mysteries:- Inheritance is 2 things in one. A Kinetic mystery novel and a hidden object puzzler, with other puzzle elements thrown in. Now me, I am one of those people who have trouble finding their keys to the house or car, let alone finding objects in a puzzle. But Time Mystery was an absolute fun game to play. 

The story is about Vivian Ambrose, who comes home after a night on the town, after winning a science award (Hottest Nerd Chick of 2013), to find her father missing.  She starts to regret the ten margaritas she had when she is shocked to find a talking orb, which tells her a strange time traveller has kidnapped her father. She now rethinks her life of hard drugs to be a bad thing, when she is told by the talking ball, that she must now travel through time and collect special rings to free her father.

Game Play
First up you look around rooms to find areas of interest, like finding hidden safes or closed draws ect. Some of these will have marble or memory puzzles, but most of the time the puzzle will be a hidden item pictures.

As with most hidden items games you get a list of items to find. There is no timers so you can go at your own leisure or if you find the hidden item a bit frustrating you can hit the old HINT button to which Tinker Bell flies to the item and yells ‚ÄúLOSER!‚Äù. If you want a change you can flip the mini-game to a ball drop puzzler similar to something like Bejewelled or Bubble Trouble. And if all else fails you can skip certain puzzles (Run you coward!).

As you solve each time line, without being hunted by time cops or grammar Nazis, you receive a ring to take back to your time machine, then you go on to the next area in history.

Inner Workings
Game graphics is a nicely done comic style, but Artifex Mundi has cheated a bit, by using picture warping to make people look like they are talking or moving. It works sometimes and other times it just looks weird, especially when Vivian smiles, which looks like she is snarling and about to rip someone‚Äôs throat out.

Voice acting is sub-par and at times destroys the atmosphere of the game created by the music, which is done well and keeps to the time period that you visit.

The story plot is not going to win any Hemingway Award but it flows nicely and keeps you hooked.

There is two game modes Regular and Expert.  Regular Mode your hint and skip meter/bar fill up fast, areas of interest are indicated with fairy dust and there is no penalty for extra clicking in the hidden object scenes.  With Expert mode the hint and skip fill slowly, there is no area of interest indication (no Fairy dust), and you are penalised for extra clicks in hidden object areas.

Time Mystery:- Inheritance is a surprisingly good game, I enjoyed playing it through to the end, which I did in a solid 3 hrs on regular mode. After the first time through, there may not be much replay value. Now, I wish there was a Hint button so I can find these damn car keys!

Original review posted at  https://cassus.org/muut/#!/adventure  For all your Indie gaming discussion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032542311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1486937119}
review:
You'd be better off either getting a pure hidden object game or checking out one of the later adventure/hidden object hybrids made by Artifex Mundi.

The adventure game elements just aren't working yet in this game. The game is broken into several distinct parts, so the adventure game puzzles can never get past basic complexity. This is probably for the best, because the game often had trouble communicating the current goal. Either the instructions were so vague that I could only just step through the active elements, or the objectives would give me information about things I had not yet found when I found part of a solution to a problem I hadn't encountered yet. The communication problem also extended to the various minigame puzzles where the player has to infer the goal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1486922558}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

L'histoire n'est pas inint√©ressante, m√™me si assez tir√©e par les cheveux. Les sc√®nes d'objets cach√©s sont correctes, mais les effets de lumi√®res peuvent √™tre p√©nibles sur certaines.

Mais ce qui plombe le jeu pour ma part, c'est les enchainements entre les sc√®nes d'objets cach√©s et les puzzles : ils sont inexistants. Aucune liaisons, aucune explications... on est balad√©s sans vraiment savoir o√π on va.

[h1]Rejouabilit√©, achievements[/h1]

Points positifs : quelques achievements faciles √† obtenir.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Il y a de bien meilleurs jeux d'objets cach√©s chez Artifex Mundi, par exemple la saga avec Davy Jones. Alors √† moins de vouloir finir tous leurs jeux... passez votre chemin.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Aucun soucis rencontr√©.

OS: Linux Mint 18 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i5 3570K OC@4.5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 16GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079168043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1486733608}
review:
Hatte mir durchaus mehr versprochen.
Die Chracteranimationen sind extrem merkw√ºrdig und der Spielablauf ist extrem eint√∂nig. Die Zeitreisenidee ist zwar ganz nett, aber man verbringt in jeder Epoche vllt 5 Minuten, bis man den Ring hat, dann gibts eine Fehlersuche und ein Wimmelbild und dann gehts wieder von vorne los.
Die Wimmelbilder sind an sich nicht schwer, werden aber dadurch nervig, dass das Wimmelbild im Hauptraum extrem st√∂rende Lichteffekte hat und das teilweise die Dinge, die man sucht, einfach so abstrus bezeichnet (oder √ºbersetzt) sind dass man da ohne Tipp oder stupides Umherklicken gar nicht drauf kommt. (Wenn unten Ventilator steht, suche ich nicht nach einem F√§cher zB...)

F√ºr 2,50 im Sale ists ne nette Besch√§ftigung f√ºr einen Nachmittag, wenn man nichts zu tun hat, aber wenn ich den vollen Preis bezahlt h√§tte, h√§tte ich mich echt dr√ºber ge√§rgert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046065881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1487289851}
review:
I can't recommend this game. But I won't go as far as to say you shouldn't buy it, either. 

If you are considering getting it...

1) Buy it on sale.
2) If you're used to playing more recent AM games, lower your expectations.

The game's not great. But if you know what you're getting going in (and you bought it on sale), it's probably fine to kill a slow evening or two with. See adam1224's review [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/adam1224/recommended/350010/] here [/url] for a more detailed explanation. 

PS I almost exclusively play offline. I typically only play online long enough for Steam to allow me to write a review. So Steam only shows that I played 0.1 hrs although I've played at least 5 hrs and have completed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1484113373}
review:
Time traveling HOG, I liked how we kept traveling back in time to solve a mystery but I didn't like the voice acting at all, nor the characters, maybe except for the main character. The story of the guy coming from the future was meh, other than that the hidden objects scenes are easy and nicely done.

Pro:
+Time traveling
+Good hidden object scenes
+Voice acting is average but not bad
+Music
+Steam achievements 

Cons:
-Characters design
-Ball reminds me of 80's sci-fi TV shows

I recommend it if you just want to chill and enjoy a hidden object game without comparing it with other 'new' ones.

review:
Didn't mind this game at all. By the numbers HOP game, some new puzzle types I haven't seen before, but then again, I haven't played too many HOP games yet.

Really liked the music, reminds me a lot of Dream Theather for some reason.

The lack of a save game function make's it very frustrating, at the very least these game types should have a save at least at the start of each chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143407172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1479509716}
review:
With broken heart I have no choice but not to recommend this game.

Why?

Almost everything about this game is wrong. I am not against simple stories but this one specifically is incredibly stupid and the same applies for in-game dialogues while gameplay is too repetitive and only thing that breaks you away from routine is ending which I wish I could unsee - that bad it is.

I have really hard times to find something so that I could recommend this game but nothing really stands out against mentioned above. Get it only if you are hardcore AM fan and want to complete or own every single game from them or if you are perfect-games hunter (there is only few achievements which are not hard to get). Even after that try to get in on sale. And even after getting it on sale it is questionable if this game is worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999921146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1482625531}
review:
Un petit jeu d'Objets Cach√©s tr√®s simple et sans grande difficult√©.

Des sc√®nes d'Objets Cach√©s, quelques puzzles (dont un qui m'a demand√© pas mal de temps et finallement de la chance), des 7 diff√©rences, du Master Mind... on est dans le classique. Le sc√©nario est simpliste mais fait son travail en servant de transition aux enchainements de tableaux.

On y retrouve les √©ceuils classiques de traduction lors des phases d'OC (mais au final moins que d'habitude il me semble). Les graphismes sont corrects pour ce genre de production et les animations des personnages ressemblent parfois √† des d√©formations. J'ai m√™me trouv√© les tableaux plus agr√©ables car assez lisibles (il y a un effet de lumi√®re g√™nant sur certains d'entres eux), bon... parfois il faut bien chercher quand m√™me.

Le jeu me semble faisable entre 2 et 3 heures. Personellement, j'ai pass√© beaucoup de temps sur une seule √©nigme (le plateau de pi√®ces √† retourner dans la hutte de la sorci√®re) mais il est toujours possible de "passer" une √©preuve. A noter qu'il manque parfois un peu de consignes mais globalement il n'est pas difficile de comprendre ce qu'il faut faire.

Jeu en VOSTF.

Ce n'est pas un HOC exceptionnel, il ravira surement les amateurs du genre et les personnes ne voulant pas trop se prendre la t√™te.

A prendre √† tr√®s petit prix, existe en Pack "Time Mysteries".

author: {'steamid': '76561198012003855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1479621688}
review:
I'm a big fan of these types of games, but I couldn't get behind this one.

The story was pretty bad and they had you doing the same things over and over. The worst part was the hidden object scenes where the items were almost unidentifiable. Add to that the fact that there were bright lights that kept pulsing on and off during these scenes which made it painful to even try to find items. 

I didn't really enjoy this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1479523148}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Point and click hidden object game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

You can have different profile slots.
There is a music volume slidebar.
There is a sound volume slidebar.
Able to toggle the voice over.
There is normal and expert mode.


[h1]About the game.[/h1]

You are trying to find out the mystery of your own family and you will enter and travel from era to era. You have to collect rings in order to move to the next era. You are able to play a different minigame when you are doing the hidden object. This minigame is 10 faster and easier to complete then doing the hidden object. Each time you have filled up the bar, you get a question mark and if you pop that. You will cross off 1 random hidden object. It's sort of ruining the purpose of the hidden object.

Alternative way to beat hidden objects.
There is a hint system.
There is voice over and it sounds a bit "stale" (without an expression).
The subtitles are voiced over.
Has puzzles.
Lot of collectables.
Weak guide lines.
There is video animation/cutscene.
There is only a map available if you have unlocked the time machine thing.
Sometimes during the hidden object scene. The objects are BEHIND every decoration. Which makes it impossible to see with the bare eyes.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

It's an okay game but the "toggle minigame" at hidden objects really ruins the game. So i can;t give it a high number.

But i do have enjoyed the era switches

-------------------

I Give this game a 7/10

review: This one sits on the poorer side of average and is not what we've come to expect of Artifex Mundi. The story is OK but the graphics are below the usual standard and use a bizarre mathod of facial distortion when characters are talking. It's very odd indeed. The voice acting is ordinary, too. Perhaps this is an older title that shows where they've come from or it may be another company's work but there are much better options around. It's OK to pass the time for a couple of hours but don't expect the usual AM quality here. 4/10.

review:
Ugh. It's so hard to actually recommend this game - it's quite contrasting against the other Artifex Mundi games I played. It lacked proper polish and quality. Story wasn't really good - they never are extraordinary 'that much' in HOGs, but this one was very uninteresting.
It feels like 2006, not 2014 (or 2010) game.
[b]Gameplay is less than 2 hours.[/b]

Conclusion:
If you are huge fan of HOGs, they probably you should get it anyway. But otherwise, for casual gamers of HOGs like me - I'd advice you to skip this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197896761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1477807711}
review:
In this remastered HOG u are trying to save ur father from doing lots of time traveling.

The characters are ok, the bg are blurry, the music I liked a lot, and the VA was ok. I really wish that they left the faces alone. When ever the characters talk there faces become extremely wavy like there heads are about to explode LOL.  

The reason why I'm giving this a positive review is because I didn't have high hopes for the story. My expectations where low. I read the reviews before starting the game and I do agree that the story was weak. The story if polished could of been soooo much better. The ending could of been much better.

Honestly the only thing that really borthered me about this HOG is the amount of blurriness in this game is just too much. Due to this lots of the HOG items are hard to find. U do have a sonar and without that sonar finding some of the HOG items could of been even more painful. It's too bad because if the game wasn't so blurry the game would of been beautiful. I have never used a guide so much before for HOG scenes. The reason for this is because I wanted to get the achievements and had to use the BigfishGames guide due to the blurriness being bad:( Yeah even the game being remastered wasn't good LOL.

One other weird thing is that for some reason the puzzles do not have instructions so u either guess what u do or consult a guide. In this case BigfishGames saved me again for the puzzles. Some puzzles I didn't undertand what I had to do. On their site they have pictures of the puzzles with the instructions on them. But be warned doing that will of course spoil how to complete the puzzle.

This HOG had no map. The thing is that the way the game was done that no map was really needed.

This HOG also has no bonus features.

I did read that this is Artifex's first game and wow does it show. I read this HOG was made on 2010 not too long ago. It's amazing how far Artifex has come along over the years. 

I got this HOG for I believe about $1.50-$2.00. I highly recommend getting this HOG for the price range I listed. This HOG was ok.

Now onward to play the second Time Mystery HOG. Hopefully the second one is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1476647575}
review:
Overview: Hidden Object Game

The Average:

The game follows the same ‚Äòformula‚Äô. Complete a level, then complete a mini game where you have to find the differences between two photos and then do it all over again.  Each level consists of two areas and a few hidden object and mini games. 

The Bad:

- The hidden object games are too hard, many items are practically blended into the background forcing you to click everywhere at random. 

- Mini games are not explained very well

- Voice acting is awful 

Conclusion:

Artifex Mundi makes some great hidden object games, sadly this isn‚Äôt one of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1475467536}
review:
Time Mysteries: Inheritance is the first game in a trilogy, and it really shows it's age. Even remastered, the HO scenes are poorly defined which makes finding a lot of objects more frustrating than challenging.
The entire game is voice acted, and the quality of the acting varies from character to character. Outside of the HO scenes, the graphics are ok, but fall far short of more modern games from the genre. The music and sound are simply average, and the storyline feels simply like a device to move you from HO scene to HO scene, rather than the HO scenes being part of the story. The puzzles vary between very easy, and very tricky.
You play Vivian Ambrose, a time traveller who must recover all seven of your family rings, you do this by travelling to different time periods to meet your ancestors, help them with problems, or to prove to them that you are worthy of being an Ambrose.
If you are an experienced HO player, the game is short, the story not particularly strong, the puzzles easy for the most part, and the HO scenes poorly defined and frustrating, and overall, disappointing for an Artifex Mundi	game, especially considering the price, which is more expensive that much better more modern games.

It's not terrible, certainly not bad enough to thumbs down as it is the introduction to a series that gets better, but try to pick this up in a sale or bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025095151', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1474771261}
review:
I really struggled with this game. I normally really enjoy these hidden object games, but this one is really rough around the edges.  The mini games feel recycled.  Several of the hidden object puzzles are on a canvas like scene and it's incredibly hard to make out the hidden objects. Yes, I know this is a hidden object game and it's supposed to be challenging. I frequently found myself tapping on random blobs and hoping they were objects.  I'm an hour into the squeal and there are some definite improvements.

Got this in a bundle and played on a Surface Pro

author: {'steamid': '76561198081224926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1474506666}
review:
As a first timer to these hidden object games, I have to say that I'm glad I started with this one.

Thanks to a simple inquiry on someone else's review, I found myself receiving this game as a gift(thanks, adam1224 =] ).

As far as the game itself, it's pretty simple to breakdown.

PROS:
+ Nice Atmosphere
+ Beautiful Soundtrack
+ Hidden objects are well hidden

CONS:
- Lacking variety in artwork environments
- Some hidden objects are a bit TOO well hidden

IN BETWEENS:
= Story is OK but not thrilling
= Voice acting is decent but the main antagonist sounds like a robot
   (not sure if this is intentional or not)
= Some artwork towards the end is very pixelated compared to the rest of the game

OVERALL:

It's a decent little adventure not without flaws. I could have surely completed it sooner than 7 hours but again this was my first venture into this genre. I enjoyed getting my feet wet but I get the feeling I'll see why it's not as praised as other games in the genre(and by Artifex Mundi in particular) soon enough.

Now on to the next two in the series.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198047299247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1472855372}
review: Even by Casual hidden object game standards this was boring. The story and voice acting are boring and horrible. The characters? Might as well not be there. The puzzles are average and there are a lot of tideous hidden object puzzles. It does give you an alternative to the HOPs, but that game is just as boring. The game was a tedious effort to get through. Only buy it if it's on sale for a low, low price. Otherwise, skip it.

review: Buah! El peor juego de Artifex de los que he jugado... y con diferencia! No puede ser m√°s absurdo, repetitivo y f√°cil (a excepci√≥n de cuando las cosas est√°n mal traducidas, que entonces es el √∫nico momento en el que tiene emoci√≥n el juego porque no sabes qu√© buscar :D)

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1471954166}
review:
Simply a masterpiece of a hidden object game. 

Wonderful voice acting, enchanting scenary, fun puzzle and you need a good eye and sharp mind to play this game.

The story is about 6-7 hours long and you are a daughter of a immortal time travel family that stumble upon the family secret and try to rescue your father though time and space. 

The picture, animation and music for every scene and every puzzle was done really well and I enjoy this one very much.

100% achievement is also quite easy .. just play though the game without using hints and you should miss any achievement at all. (don't click the hint button by accident even.)

9/10 for a great and wonderful hidden object advanture game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025562329', 'num_games_owned': 1788, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1471759121}
review: Having played some of the other Artifex Mundi titles, this one was a bad surprise for me. Boring and easy, with annoying lighting effects on some HO scenes. Object locations are too obvious, and the puzzles repetitive. The music is not bad and the voices are funny, characters are weird. I just hope that the other Time Mistery games are better than this. 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028376580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1702032908}
review: I wasn't overly impressed by this game. I usually try to avoid using hints or skipping mini-games, but this game just didn't grab my interest, so I found myself using those way more often than usually. The voice acting wasn't very good, and the character's faces distorted in a strange way when they spoke. Most of the dialogue sounded very forced and unnatural. Some of the hidden object puzzles had really bad graphics, so it was hard to make things out. A lot of them also had this annoying light effect where the light was constantly going from darker to lighter and back. I liked the story, but the implementation was bad enough to make the game not so enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979068807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1470314569}
review:
Il tema dei viaggi nel tempo √® spinoso sia nel mondo cinematografico sia nel mondo videoludico. Time Mysteries √® uno di quei titoli che non √® riuscito assolutamente a centrare il bersaglio. Come punta-e-clicca non √® sicuramente all'avanguardia e non inserisce nulla di nuovo nel sistema classico dei puzzle game di queste tipologie di giochi. La grafica √® obsoleta e le animazioni abbastanza scarse, l'audio √® mediocre. Tutto, secondo me, si sarebbe dovuto basare sulla storia, ma come detto all'inizio il risultato √® stato davvero deludente.

Voto: 3,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993803638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1470141973}
review:
WARNING: Publisher admits game is BROKEN and cannot be fixed.
One item in a hidden object scene is missing meaning it's impossible to get all acheivements. You can pass the game but it's highly disappointing.

----

Unsatisfying and creepy. Decent enough to get on the cheap (<$5).

A lot of little things bugged me. Nothing game-breaking.
*some voice overs got cut off.
*mystery guy sounds like a robot.
*inconsistent/eroneous object clues.
*many differences to spot are too subtle
*weird pulsing of light in HO sections is very annoying.
*I appreciate the sonar. However, showing objects as they appear behind other objects usually ends up more as a hinderance.
*vague plot point at the end is never elaborated on.

What really made it creepy for me is the weird photomanipulations in the cutscenes. It would have been enough to make the lips move but trying to make 2D images move like 3D was a mistake in my opinion. The sad part is that all that effort was probably an aspect of the "remastering".

It was functional and mostly enjoyable but I wouldn't rush out to get it. There are no added frills. The achievements are attainable and I've definitely played worse.
